nodes.text: The Ithorian male Murr Danod was a Force-attuned smuggler who worked for a trade guild in the year 32 BBY. He enjoyed dealing in morally gray items but treated his customers with honesty. Danod was a Podracing fan, and in 32 BBY, he attended the Boonta Eve Classic race on the planet Tatooine.

Murr Danod was an Ithorian male who lived during the final years of the Galactic Republic. A smuggler, he worked for a trade guild that operated out of an Ithorian Herdship. In 32 BBY, Danod attended the annual Boonta Eve Classic Podrace at the Mos Espa Grand Arena on the planet Tatooine. From his seat in the audience, the Ithorian watched as the Dug Podracer Sebulba completed the first of three scheduled laps.

Murr Danod had white eyes and possessed skin the same color as the morality of the items he smuggled: gray. He enjoyed such dealings but was nevertheless a peaceful being who was honest to his customers. Danod was Force-attuned and a fan of Podracing.

The head and neck of Murr Danod first appeared in the audience during the Podracing sequence of the 1999 film Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace. Initially unnamed, the character received an identity and backstory on a card included in the 2001 Coruscant Limited expansion set of the Star Wars Customizable Card Game.
